alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 5:47AM CDT until March 30 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH AND NORTHEASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES... At 546 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles north of Spiro to near Lake Wister State Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Poteau... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Spiro... Arkoma... Panama... Wister... Howe... Cameron... Moffett... Lake Wister State Park... Shady Point... Rock Island... Scullyville... Braden... Cottonwood... Dora... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 318 and 328. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northwestern Arkansas...and southeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
